Contributor.Organization: University of British Columbia, BC Childrenâ€™s Hospital Research Institute

Sample.Title: MSTN-treated 24h rep1

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA from human primary trophoblasts was extracted using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer's instructions. Sample quality control was performed using the Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer. Qualifying samples were then prepped following the standard protocol for the NEBnext Ultra ii Stranded mRNA (New England Biolabs).

Sample.Data-Processing: De-multiplexed sequences were aligned to the Homo sapiens (UCSC hg19) reference sequence using STAR aligner Fragments per kilobase of exon per million reads (FPKM) estimation of reference genes and transcripts using Cufflinks 2 Assembly of novel transcripts with Cufflinks 2 Differential expression of novel and reference transcripts with Cuffdiff 2 Assembly: GRCh37 (hg19) Supplementary files format and content: *.genes.fpkm_tracking: Tab-delimited text files include FPKM values for each gene.

Series.Title: Myostatin Increases Trophoblast Cell Invasion Through Regulating Epithelial Mesenchymal Transition Genes
Series.Summary: Myostatin (MSTN) is a TGF-Î² superfamily member and was recently shown to be secreted and functioning in the placenta. In this study, we perfomed mRNA sequencing on control and MSTN-treated primary trophoblast cells to decipher the underlying molecular mechanisms involved in MSTN-induced human trophoblast cell invasion.
Series.Overall-Design: Primary human trophoblasts from first-trimester placentas (n=5) were isolated and cultured with or without 50 ng/mL MSTN for 24 hours. Total RNA was extracted for transcriptomic analysis. Please note that the samples have been analyzed with the control group previously deposited in GSE172040.
Series.Type: Expression profiling by high throughput sequencing
